alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; East Bay Interior Valleys; North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 12:15PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A shower producing small hail will impact portions of southeastern Marin, northwestern Alameda, west central Contra Costa and San Francisco Counties through 1245 PM PDT... At 1214 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a shower producing small hail near San Francisco, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley, Richmond, San Pablo, El Cerrito, Hercules, Albany, Pinole, Tara Hills, Rollingwood, El Sobrante, Kensington, East Richmond Heights, Bayview-Montalvin and East Richmond Heigts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
